sentences.sContent: If you need more information, you might try the Internet.
sentences.sCn: 如果你需要更多的信息，可以试试因特网。

sentences.sContent: I thought we might go to the new Chinese restaurant on the High Street.
sentences.sCn: 我想我们可以到大街上新开的那家中国餐馆去。

sentences.sContent: It might be a good idea to put those plants in the shade.
sentences.sCn: 把那些植物放在阴凉处也许是个好主意。

sentences.sContent: We’re going to a concert. You might like to come with us.
sentences.sCn: 我们要去听音乐会，你也许想和我们一起去吧。

sentences.sContent: ...I thought that someone might do something stupid...
...He knew my love for yoga and had seen a space close to where he lived that he thought might be good to serve as a yoga studio...
...And such research might even suggest ways for us all to relive our past with greater clarity...
...So it might be a good idea to get someone else to drive you home after that marathon...
...This led her to wonder if people might be doing the same thing...
...A rat or pigeon might not be the obvious choice to tend to someone who is sick...
...The puzzle was what benefit would be gained from it when performance might be affected the following day...
...aging itself might be seen as something treatable...
...A person who bad input into where he would move and has had time to adapt to it might do as well in a nursing home as in a small residential care home...

phrases.pCn: 倒不如；满可以；还是…好；最好还是
无稽之谈；奇迹可能会发生

words.tran: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的

trans.tranOther: if something might happen or might be true, there is a possibility that it may happen or may be true, but you are not at all certain
